buildup.text: Stress testing applies historical crash scenarios to your current portfolio to see how it holds up.

discovery.text: Common scenarios: the 2008 financial crisis, the 2000 dot-com bust, and the 1970s stagflation era.

twist.text: A portfolio that survives all three stress tests is more resilient than one that aced only the latest crash.

climax.text: Free tools like Portfolio Visualizer let anyone backtest allocations against decades of real data.

punchline.text: Test your portfolio in a simulator so you don't have to test it in a crisis.

quiz.question: What is portfolio stress testing?
options: Applying historical crash scenarios to your allocation
